result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas Allen Strohacker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments, Repeater, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B", Increased Penalty - Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Surcharge], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant shall undergo AODA assessment, treatment and counseling.
Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and counseling deemed appropriate by Agent to include domestic violence.
NO CONTACT WITH: M.K. except pre-approved by agent.  Contact re: minor child placement through a 3rd party.

Costs, surcharges & supervision fees to be paid during the term of probation as arranged by the agent.
Submit DNA sample.
